title: General Knowledge Quiz
description: Test your knowledge with these general knowledge questions
creator: admin

questions.text: Which planet in our solar system has the most moons?
questions.explanation: Saturn has 82 confirmed moons, surpassing Jupiter's 79.

questions.text: Who painted the Mona Lisa?
questions.explanation: The Mona Lisa was painted by Leonardo da Vinci around 1503-1506.

questions.text: What is the capital of Australia?
questions.explanation: Canberra is the capital city of Australia.

questions.text: Which element has the chemical symbol 'Au'?
questions.explanation: The chemical symbol 'Au' stands for Gold, from the Latin word 'aurum'.

questions.text: In which year did World War I begin?
questions.explanation: World War I began in 1914 and ended in 1918.

title: Science Quiz
description: Test your scientific knowledge with these challenging questions
creator: admin

questions.text: What is the speed of light in a vacuum?
questions.explanation: The speed of light in a vacuum is approximately 299,792 kilometers per second.

questions.text: Which of these is not a fundamental force in physics?
questions.explanation: Centrifugal force is a fictitious force, not a fundamental force in physics.

questions.text: What is the chemical formula for sulfuric acid?
questions.explanation: The chemical formula for sulfuric acid is H2SO4.

questions.text: What is the name of the process by which plants make their own food?
questions.explanation: Plants make their own food through photosynthesis, using sunlight, water, and carbon dioxide.

questions.text: What is the smallest unit of life?
questions.explanation: The cell is considered the smallest unit of life that can function independently.

title: History Quiz
description: Test your knowledge of historical events and figures
creator: admin

questions.text: Who was the first President of the United States?
questions.explanation: George Washington served as the first President of the United States from 1789 to 1797.

questions.text: In which year did the Berlin Wall fall?
questions.explanation: The Berlin Wall fell on November 9, 1989.

questions.text: Which ancient civilization built the Machu Picchu complex in Peru?
questions.explanation: Machu Picchu was built by the Inca civilization around 1450 AD.

questions.text: Who was the first woman to win a Nobel Prize?
questions.explanation: Marie Curie was the first woman to win a Nobel Prize (Physics) in 1903, and later won a second Nobel Prize in Chemistry.

questions.text: Which event marked the beginning of World War II?
questions.explanation: World War II began with Nazi Germany's invasion of Poland on September 1, 1939.

title: Technology Quiz
description: Test your knowledge about modern technology and computing
creator: admin

questions.text: Who co-founded Apple Computer with Steve Jobs?
questions.explanation: Steve Wozniak co-founded Apple Computer (now Apple Inc.) with Steve Jobs in 1976.

questions.text: What does 'HTTP' stand for in website addresses?
questions.explanation: HTTP stands for HyperText Transfer Protocol, the foundation of data communication on the World Wide Web.

questions.text: Which programming language was developed by James Gosling at Sun Microsystems?
questions.explanation: Java was developed by James Gosling at Sun Microsystems and released in 1995.

questions.text: What is the name of the virtual assistant developed by Amazon?
questions.explanation: Alexa is the virtual assistant developed by Amazon, first used in the Amazon Echo smart speaker.

questions.text: What year was the first iPhone released?
questions.explanation: The first iPhone was released by Apple in 2007, revolutionizing the smartphone industry.

title: Pop Culture Quiz
description: Test your knowledge of movies, music, and pop culture
creator: admin

questions.text: Which actor played Iron Man in the Marvel Cinematic Universe?
questions.explanation: Robert Downey Jr. played Tony Stark/Iron Man in the Marvel Cinematic Universe.

questions.text: Which band performed the song 'Bohemian Rhapsody'?
questions.explanation: Bohemian Rhapsody was performed by the British rock band Queen, released in 1975.

questions.text: Which TV series features characters named Ross, Rachel, Monica, Chandler, Joey, and Phoebe?
questions.explanation: These characters are from the popular sitcom Friends, which aired from 1994 to 2004.

questions.text: Who is the author of the Harry Potter book series?
questions.explanation: J.K. Rowling is the author of the Harry Potter fantasy series.

questions.text: Which video game franchise features a character named Master Chief?
questions.explanation: Master Chief is the main protagonist of the Halo video game franchise.
